channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: RPI Libraries is here to support you during study days and finals
item.description: Study late at the Folsom Library on reading and study days. We’re open during finals week until 1 am most days. Argo Tea will also have extended hours. Schedule your study breaks! Folsom Library will have crafts, activities, games, and plushie study buddies available. Show off your RPI knowledge in our staff-created Jeopardy game and exchange your answer card for some study candy at the Service Desk. Bring your family in after commencement! We are open on Saturday, 5/10, from 2 pm to 6 pm.
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI’s Path to Space by Project Ascendant | April 26
item.description: Date: Saturday, April 26, 2025 1:00 AM - 3:00 AM - Join the Project Ascendant group (@ascendantspace)for their final design review “RPI’s Path to Space”. The Ascendant Research Group is an experimental rocketry group with space as the ultimate goal. Affiliated with @rpirockets.
item.author: Students

item.title: Spring 2025 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 (all day) - Spring 2025 student course evaluations are now open. The evaluation period is from 4/11 through 4/24. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Thursday, April 24, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work hosts Analytics, Machine Learning & AI Review April 24
item.description: Date: Thursday, April 24, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., on a 30-minute information session highlighting Rensselaer online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning & AI. Expect to learn how data can inform better decisions and review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please register if you plan to attend.

item.title: Does Your Syllabus Need a Tune-Up? HelioCampus Syllabus Assistance Available
item.description: Are you new to HelioCampus? Would you like to give your syllabus a “tune-up? Come to the Fischbach Room in the library on May 7 at 10:00 for assistance. Amy Svirsky, RPI’s Learning Assessment Specialist, will be there to assist you, answer your questions and show you how to use the tool.

item.title: Teaching & Learning Collaboratory In-Person Spring Event - Learning Today: Neuroscience, Digital Technologies, and Distraction | May 13
item.description:
The Office of Undergraduate Education and the Teaching and Learning Collaboratory are pleased to announce our spring guest speaker, James M. Lang, who will talk on Learning Today: Neuroscience, Digital Technologies, and Distraction on May 13th from 11 - 12:45pm. Please review session details. Registration required by May 5th. We look forward to seeing you there!
